intro: Hesperalbizia occidentalis, commonly known as the western albizia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across desert regions. Hesperalbizia occidentalis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
